title: SQLCREATE PROCEDURE Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLCREATE PROCEDURE Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
CREATE PROCEDURE
The
CREATE PROCEDURE
command is used to 
create a stored procedure.
A stored procedure is a prepared SQL code that you can save, so the 
code can be reused over and over again.
The following SQL creates a stored procedure named "SelectAllCustomers" 
that selects all records from the "Customers" table:
Example
CREATE PROCEDURE SelectAllCustomers
AS
SELECT * FROM Customers
GO;
Execute the stored procedure above as follows:
Example
EXEC SelectAllCustomers;

Reference

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
CREATE PROCEDURE SelectAllCustomers
AS
SELECT * FROM Customers
GO;

practice_exercises.solution:

SELECT * FROM Customers
GO;
